69a015ebfe18fc6dfbd151c0b269ff26 (23:36): Is there a reason, why <mark> is just phrasing content?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:40): 69a015ebfe18fc6dfbd151c0b269ff26: because its primary purpose is to mark frex search terms in a page.
69a015ebfe18fc6dfbd151c0b269ff26 (23:41): I was thinking more about the usage in blockquotes.
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:45): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: "frex"?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:45): frex = for example
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:47): 69a015ebfe18fc6dfbd151c0b269ff26: Oh, so you wanna <mark> a block of markup within a <blockquote>?
69a015ebfe18fc6dfbd151c0b269ff26 (23:48): The concrete use case were two paragraphs, yes.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:52): Hrm.  FF respects styling when printing to the point of cutting off ordinary text in a fixed-width container that is wider than the page.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:52): That's a little annoying.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:53): Probably required, but still.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:55): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: Was there a point to the email you just sent, or is just a summary of things?

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:58): It's not even using of the new HTML5 elements, for starters.  I guess this would be best shared with a cross compatibility or css channel.  Sorry.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:01): What should we be scrutinizing about it, 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:03): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: did the document pointer stuff change in xhr?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:05): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, what was previously defined did not work for when the interface object was moved around

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:06): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, I just fouled up where I should have posted it.  I've been writing my own normalize.css that I *think* is better than any of the major ones out there.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:06): They're always trying to re-globalize what everything means instead of actually normalize between the browsers.

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:07): I'm hoping we can switch to that from the yui one.  However, I ended up removing all of the html5 elements from the document, so it killed the point of having you folks scrutinize my use of any specific html5 elements.

6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:07): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I'm not totally clear on whether all the details are correct now to be honest; I have attempted to test it, but some of the details of how document/window interact and "fully active document" make it a bit hard

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:07): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: if you could comment on http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=7373 regarding what the new text for XHR documents should be, that'd be great
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, there's a XMLHttpRequest origin concept
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, "Each XMLHttpRequest object has an associated XMLHttpRequest origin and an XMLHttpRequest base URL."
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:08): We're working on making our layouts more robust and outline friendly @ http://madison.thewikies.com/alloy/960_grid.html
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:09): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: Eh, all of the html5 elements default to margin-less inline elements anyway, so just put whatever you want in your file.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:09): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, no they should be block elements in my document, IF they were there.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:09): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: if you could mention that on the bug that'd be awesome
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:09): i gotta run
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:09): Those layouts in that last grid are cross browser compatible, but still give us a lot of flexability in layouts.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:09): bbiab
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:10): Yeah, but you have to set them like that in current parsers.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:11): Well, of course, but we'll be supporting ie8 for a while, I suspect, so might as well declare the elements and give them the proper style.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (01:12): Firefox needs them too, I know, but just the css.
